main event: A bright, circular object was observed moving at a high rate of speed at an altitude of 12,000 to 15,000 feet in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on 27 September 1954. The sighting lasted four minutes and was reported by a pilot of an aircraft en route from Washington, D.C. to Newark, N.J.
interesting points: The object was observed by a pilot, adding credibility to the sighting.
It was moving southwest at a high rate of speed, indicating unusual flight characteristics.
The object was observed at a significant altitude of 12,000 to 15,000 feet, ruling out conventional aircraft.
The report states that physical evidence was present, although it does not provide details about this evidence.
Despite the observation, the conclusion stated insufficient data for evaluation.
